main event: A UFO sighting was reported in West Point, Kentucky on January 22, 1954, involving a bright light flashing up and down, resembling a spotlight. There were no other witnesses to the event.
interesting points: The UFO sighting lasted for 25 minutes, allowing for a prolonged observation of the strange phenomenon.
The UFO was described as resembling a spotlight and appeared to move up and down, disappearing and reappearing never in the same place.
Despite the visual observation, the object did not appear on radar and there were no unusual phenomena reported on radar search at 72nd ACW 50 at 12 miles south of West Point.
The witnesses, identified as Mr. and Mrs., were an apprentice electrician and housewife, adding a sense of credibility to the sighting.
The report was received at Wright-Patterson Flight Service from Godman AFB, KY, suggesting that it was formally documented by relevant military and aviation authorities.
sighted object: bright light resembling a spotlight moving up and down
witnesses: Mr. and Mrs., an electrician and a housewife
